page.title: 14WILDLIFE IN THE AREA
page.content: There is a varied selection of wildlife in this area, of which the bird life is more easy to spot and identify. The land slopes heavily and rises to about 1000 ft, the top 300 ft of which are mainly moorland and heather. The land is open and barren with few trees and only ground cover. This provides an ideal area for oyster catchers, curlews and lapwings inhabit. Grouse are normally present in large numbers here but in recent years Central Perthshire has seen a sharp decline in their numbers although they now seem to be returning slowly. Amongst the animals seen were hares,rabbits and deer. Other birds found further down the hill were crows, pigeons, cuckoos, various hawks and jackdaws.
